replies.name: Recently in January '23
replies.content: January, the infamous first month of the year, is reaching an end. It was a very eventful month, but, by this time, I feel like I say that for every month that passes. I am honestly hoping that February will be a slightly more boring month in that sense.âœï¸ WebsiteDuring January, I did not made large changes to this website. In general, they were rather small even though they may seem large. In addition to fixing some bugs, as usual, I also removed by checkins ğŸ“ and itineraries ğŸ—ºï¸. I decided to do so as I felt like they did not add much to the website.Finally, I made my Trips ğŸš† page better. I think it displays the trips in a better way and it is slightly inspired by Timâ€™s logs. I still want to backup my Swarm checkins and I still have to write a script to do so. I will probably try Deno ğŸ¦–, as I have been slightly curious about it for a while!ğŸ„ LifeIn EngelbergIn terms of life events, not a lot happened, but I went to Switzerland for a small company trip. It was quite nice to see some of my coworkers again and enjoy some time with them. Besides, I went there by train which was quite an interesting experience.I took quite some pictures, but I have yet to go over them. However, I leave you one here, one of my favourites. I have been thinking about printing some of my photos ğŸ“¸ and framing them to use as decoration in the entrance hall and living room of my apartment. I think that could turn out nicely.ğŸ“š ReadingAround two weeks ago I finished reading â€œSweet Bean Pasteâ€, yet another Japanese book added to my collection. I donâ€™t know how to describe it, but itâ€™s a sweet book with a very fascinating story about friendship and love. Thereâ€™s no science fiction, thereâ€™s no technology. Just plain people and a story to it.ğŸ¿ WatchingI watched M3GAN in the cinema. M3GAN is this mix of science fiction and horror movie. I usually donâ€™t enjoy horror movies, but this one was quite interesting. I think the main problem of most horror movies is that theyâ€™re only about jump scared. But if thereâ€™s a psychological element attached to it, it becomes much more interesting.ğŸ® GamingThis is the first time I am including this section. I have acquired a PlayStation 5, as well as â€œRatchet & Clank: Rift Mattersâ€. I have always been a big fan of Ratchet & Clank, even though Iâ€™ve only had the opportunity of playing one game from it. It brings back memories, but allied to a fantastic story telling and graphics. Recommend it so far!And that was it! Letâ€™s look forward for the next month and see how this year develops. Iâ€™m looking forward to start working out more, in hopes that will also help my Achilles tendon, and to the Dutch classes - oops, I havenâ€™t said this yet - that I started taking this month!
replies.author: Henrique Dias
